metadata.title: CVE-2018-16884 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's NFS41+ subsystem. NFS41+ sharesmounted in different network namespaces at the same time can makebc_svc_process() use wrong back-channel IDs and cause a use-after-freevulnerability. Thus a malicious container user can cause a host kernelmemory corruption and a system panic. Due to the nature of the flaw,privilege escalation cannot be fully ruled out.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
